name: ABC4DE
desc: The ABC4DE web-interface allows for the analysis of sets of variants within a region of interest. For a given variant, the tool reports: 1) if it falls within a predicted regulatory region; 2) the predicted role for that region (promoter/enhancer); and 3) if the variant will alter a potential TFBSs.

name: ASB data set
desc: ASB data set contains 10,765 ASB events retrieved from 45 ENCODE ChIP-Seq data sets.

name: BiasAway
desc: An open-access tool for generating multiple different sequence backgrounds of comparable nucleotide composition relative to a set of input sequences

name: Bioconductor data package for JASPAR
desc: Transcription factor binding profile Bioconductor data package

name: CAGEd-oPOSSUM
desc: Motif enrichment analysis from CAGE-derived TSSs.

name: cis-reg-pred
desc: Open-access tool for the segmentation of the human genome. The tool uses a supervised machine learning approach to segment the human genome using experimental data in the same spirit as Segway and ChromHMM.

name: DECRES
desc: Deep learning for identifying cis-regulatory elements and other applications.

name: Deep Learning Package in Python Based on The Deep Learning Tutorials and Theano
desc: This deep learning package is an extension of the Deep Learning Tutorials (www.deeplearning.net/tutorial/).

name: DNAshapedTFBS
desc: Python module allowing for the construction and application of machine learning classifiers combining TFFM/PSSM + DNA shape features for improving the predictions of TFBSs in ChIP-seq data-sets. Highlighted by PMID: 27684185

name: Gene Characerization Index
desc: A bioinformatics method for scoring the extent to which a protein-encoding gene is functionally described

name: IEMBase
desc: Online inborn errors of metabolism knowledgebase and diagnosis support system.

name: IndelImpact
desc: Open-access software for the computation of the impact of insertions and deletions on transcription factor binding sites.

name: JASPAR
desc: The 2016 version of the JASPAR database was publicly released on November 2016 and greatly expands the number of transcription factor binding profiles from 2014. Additionally, transcription factor flexible models (TFFMs) have been provided for 130 of the transcription factors. The structural annotation of the TF DNA binding domains (DBDs) has been changed to follow a published hierarchical structural classification and a new web tool has been included to infer JASPAR TF binding profiles recognized by a given TF protein sequence. Finally, A Ruby API module has been created to accompany the existing Perl and Biopython APIs and R/Bioconductor data package.

name: JASPAR Biopython module
desc: Biopython package to access and use JASPAR binding profiles.

name: JASPAR BioRuby gem
desc: Ruby gems for parsing, searching, and comparing JASPAR motifs; Based on Bio.motifs module in Biopython.

name: MANTA
desc: SNV impact on TFBSs

name: MeSHOP
desc: Using Medical Subject Heading Overrepresentation Profiles (MeSHOPs), an entity of interest can be robustly summarized, quantitatively identifying associated biomedical terms and suggesting indirect associations

name: MSCAN
desc: Algorithm that detects clusters of transcription factor binding sites in genomic sequences

name: NHRscan
desc: A computational predictor of nuclear hormone receptor binding sites

name: oPOSSUM3
desc: A web-based system for the detection of over-represented conserved transcription factor binding sites and binding site combinations in sets of genes or sequences

name: ORCAtk
desc: Transcription factor binding site detection using phylogenetic footprinting (alternative to ConSite)

name: PAZAR
desc: An open-access system for the collection and dissemination of regulatory sequence annotation

name: TFBS perl modules
desc: Perl modules for transcription factor binding site detection and analysis

name: TFBSTools
desc: R/bioconductor package for transcription factor binding site analysis

name: TFBS_Visualization
desc: An open-access tool for visualizing and assessing transcription factor topological motif enrichment in ChIP-Seq datasets.

name: TFCat
desc: TFCat is a catalog of mouse and human TFs based on a reliable core collection of annotations obtained by expert review of the scientific literature

name: TFe
desc: An online encyclopedic collection of well-studied transcription factor proteins in the human, mouse, and rat genomes

name: TFFM
desc: Transcription Factor Flexible Models (TFFMs) are hidden Markov model (HMM) representations of TFBS motifs. This online tool allows you to generate TFFMs and scan sequences with them.

name: ConSite
desc: Transcription factor binding site detection using phylogenetic footprinting. Note that this is an older tool which is hosted remotely. You may also be interested in our ORCAtk tool which is maintained locally and performs similar functionality.

name: dbMTN
desc: Multiple Tissue Northern Blot Comparison Tool

name: Gene Set Builder
desc: A tool for collation, curation and distribution of sets of genes

name: GeneLynx
desc: A portal to the human genome. This tool was developed to fulfill a need for easily accessible gene information at a particular point in time. Having fulfilled its purpose, this tool has been retired. Current tools are available to provide similar services.

name: GOToolBox
desc: Functional Investigation of Gene Datasets

name: JASPAR 2014
desc: The 2014 version of the JASPAR database was publicly released on November 2013 with the incorporation of new and updated transcription factor binding profiles. Beyond the transcription factor binding profiles, we provide the ChIP-seq derived sequences that have been used to construct the profiles.

name: NovelFam3000
desc: A bioinformatics tool created to accelerate characterization of gene families sharing uncharacterized protein domains

name: oPOSSUM2
desc: Web-based analysis of over-represented transcription factor binding sites

name: OrthoSeq
desc: Alignment of DNA sequences

name: PFOND
desc: Developed by the Wasserman Laboratory at UBC, PFOND is a web-based service to promote the sharing of information about research, treatment, and resources for rare genetic disorders.

name: RAVEN
desc: Regulatory analysis of Variation in ENhancers

name: SAGE2Splice
desc: A tool that uses unmapped SAGE tags to predict novel splice junctions in the genome

name: Ulysses
desc: Protein Interactions Conserved Across Evolution
